item.title: Project Coments
item.description: Here you find summary of the remakrs, questions/answers about the project First project session - 19 nov. Objectives of the 1rst project session was to be able to create a short report in pdf or html using the data of the project Some advises discussed during the session (19/11) With the Rmd file try to reproduce the statement : Be sure that you have miktex installed on your pc if you wnt pdf output.

PreRequisites R Programming Rmarkdown Scientific workflow and dynamic document programming: RMardown Tuto: RMarkdown for Scientists - Nicholas Tierney Probability and Statistics References Agresti, A. 2013. Categorical Data Analysis. Wiley. Cornillon, P.A., A. Guyader, F. Husson, N. Jégou, J. Josse, M. Kloareg, E. Matzer-Lober, and L. Rouvière. 2008. Statistiques Avec R. PUR. Greene, W.H. 2008. Econometric Analysis, 6th. Prentice-HallOxford: Clarendon Press. Gujarati, D. 2003.
Recordings Recordings of the lessons are accessible on GoogleDrive

item.title: About
item.description: Description of the course Skills of the learning program To acquire overview of the supply-chain of the data management (from production to analysis and results communication) and be able to manage a data science project form end-to-end To know methods and to apply tools for data handling, cleaning and requesting To know methods and to apply tools to explore and analyze data To know methods and to apply tools specific to data characterized by two specific dimensions of the industrial big data: spatial data and temporal data Organisation of the course The course covers the whole issues of the data supply-chain: from data collection and production, storage and organization, management, exploitation and analysis, and communication.

item.title: Graphics with R
item.description: Grammar of ggplot2() Start example df <- data.frame(x=1:15, y=1:15) ggplot(df, aes(x,y)) + geom_point() + labs( title= "Plot example", subtitle = "Subtitled", x="x-values", y = "y-values" ) + theme(panel.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color= "grey50")) Grammar of graphic: ggplot The ggplot2 package is loaded to access the ggplot() function. The graph is created by stacking together several short phrases, each describing an aspect of the graphic. With ggplot, the data need need not to be reshaped for each type of graphical representation (boxplot, histogram, scatter,…).

item.title: Introduction to Data Vizualisation
item.description: Application Designing a visualization The use of visualization is pervasive in the scientific production and communication: explanatory diagrams, graphs describing statistics, new experimental data plotted against theoretical expectations, etc. In each case, the author of the visualization tries to lead readers to a specific point of view, by emphasizing some aspects of the data while toning down other aspects. Results may be informative, decisive or misleading. Can you apply the design principles we talked about in class?

item.title: Introduction to Reproducible Analysis
item.description: Reproducible Analysis Typical data analysis workflow looks like this: collect data put it in a file or spreadsheet or database run some analyses, written in various scripts, perhaps saving some intermediate results along the way or maybe always working on the raw data. create some plots or tables of relevant summaries of the data, and then go and write a report about the results in a text editor or word processor.

item.title: Introductory Cases Studies
item.description: Case Study Work group: By group of 5 to 6 students: you will explore one of the following links you will search for the data type, qualification, etc you will question the workflow supporting the website you will question the interpretation, the vizualisation of the results, its strengths and weaknesses you will present your result using an RMarkdown presentation (HTML IoSlides or Beamer) - No more than 4 slides First: names, title, link as subtitle Second: survey of the data elements Third: workflow 1 Fourth: critical analysis Cases - links CS0 - Mobility and Covid19 https://ivtmobis.
